briefTitle: A Study to Compare a New Eye Drop Formulation With Refresh Contacts®

armGroups.label: Carboxymethylcellulose Based Eye Drop Formula
interventionNames: Drug: carboxymethylcellulose based eye drop formula

armGroups.label: REFRESH CONTACTS®
interventionNames: Drug: carboxymethylcellulose sodium based eye drop solution

interventions.name: carboxymethylcellulose sodium based eye drop solution

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

-Adapted contact wearer with daily usage of at least 6 hours a day, 5 days a week.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Wearing monovision lenses
* Have had refractive surgery within the previous 12 months
* Have infection of the eye, eyelids or eye structures.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Contact Lens Distance Visual Acuity Change From Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Contact lens distance visual acuity was measured for each eye using the LogMAR visual acuity eye chart. The worse eye at Baseline was used for analysis. A change of 0.1 on the LogMAR scale was equivalent to a 1 line change in visual acuity. The following categories are reported: Better=an increase in 2 or more lines, No Change=a change of +/- 1 line, and Worse=a decrease of 2 lines or more.

outcomeMeasures.title: Average Daily Contact Wearing Time
outcomeMeasures.description: The average reported number of hours per day that contact lenses were worn by participants during the previous 7 days.

outcomeMeasures.title: Reason for Contact Lens Replacement
outcomeMeasures.description: The reason the contact lens needed to be replaced was recorded for each eye. The following categories are reported: Scheduled Replacement, Discomfort, Lens Damage, Unacceptable Vision and Lens Lost. There may be multiple reasons for replacement of the contact lens for a single eye.
